sentences.sentence: The fifth planet was very strange.
It was the smallest of all.
There was just enough room on it for a street lamp and a lamplighter( 点街灯的人 ).
The little prince was not able to reach any explanation of the use of a street lamp and a lamplighter( 点街灯的人 ),
somewhere in the heavens, on a planet which had no people, and not one house.
But he said to himself, nevertheless( 然而 ):
“It may well be that this man is absurd( 荒唐的 ). But he is not so absurd( 荒唐的 ) as the king, the conceited( 自负的 ) man, the businessman, and the tippler( 酒鬼 ). For at least his work has some meaning.
When he lights his street lamp, it is as if he brought one more star to life( 赋予...生命 ), or one flower. When he puts out his lamp, he sends the flower, or the star, to sleep.
That is a beautiful occupation( 职业 ). And since it is beautiful, it is truly useful.”
When he arrived on the planet he respectfully saluted( 向...敬礼 ) the lamplighter( 点街灯的人 ).
“Good morning. Why have you just put out your lamp?”
“Those are the orders,” replied the lamplighter( 点街灯的人 ). “Good morning.”
“What are the orders?”
“The orders are that I put out my lamp. Good evening.”
And he lighted his lamp again.
“But why have you just lighted it again?”
“Those are the orders,” replied the lamplighter( 点街灯的人 ).
“I do not understand,” said the little prince.
“There is nothing to understand,” said the lamplighter( 点街灯的人 ). “Orders are orders. Good morning.”
And he put out his lamp.
Then he mopped his forehead with a handkerchief decorated( 装饰 ) with red squares.
“I follow a terrible profession. In the old days it was reasonable. I put the lamp out in the morning, and in the evening I lighted it again.
I had the rest of the day for relaxation and the rest of the night for sleep.”
“And the orders have been changed since that time?”
“The orders have not been changed,” said the lamplighter( 点街灯的人 ). “That is the tragedy( 不幸 )! From year to year the planet has turned more rapidly and the orders have not been changed!”
“Then what?” asked the little prince.
“Then—the planet now makes a complete turn every minute, and I no longer have a single second for repose( 休息 ). Once every minute I have to light my lamp and put it out!”
“That is very funny! A day lasts only one minute, here where you live!”
“It is not funny at all!” said the lamplighter( 点街灯的人 ). “While we have been talking together a month has gone by( （时间）逝去 ).”
“A month?”
“Yes, a month. Thirty minutes. Thirty days. Good evening.”
And he lighted his lamp again.
As the little prince watched him, he felt that he loved this lamplighter( 点街灯的人 ) who was so faithful to his orders.
He remembered the sunsets which he himself had gone to seek, in other days, merely by pulling up his chair; and he wanted to help his friend.
“You know,” he said, “I can tell you a way you can rest whenever you want to . . .”
“I always want to rest,” said the lamplighter( 点街灯的人 ).
For it is possible for a man to be faithful and lazy at the same time.
The little prince went on with his explanation:
“Your planet is so small that three strides( 大步 ) will take you all the way around it. To be always in the sunshine, you need only walk along rather slowly.
When you want to rest, you will walk—and the day will last as long as you like.”
“That doesn’t do me much good,” said the lamplighter( 点街灯的人 ). “The one thing I love in life is to sleep.”
“Then you’re unlucky,” said the little prince.
“I am unlucky,” said the lamplighter( 点街灯的人 ). “Good morning.”
And he put out( 熄灭 ) his lamp.
“That man,” said the little prince to himself, as he continued farther on his journey,
“that man would be scorned( 鄙视 ) by all the others: by the king, by the conceited( 自负的 ) man, by the tippler( 酒鬼 ), by the businessman.
Nevertheless( 然而 ) he is the only one of them all who does not seem to me ridiculous( 可笑的 ). Perhaps that is because he is thinking of something else besides himself.”
He breathed a sigh of regret, and said to himself, again:
“That man is the only one of them all whom I could have made my friend. But his planet is indeed too small. There is no room on it for two people . . .”
What the little prince did not dare confess( 承认 ) was that he was sorry most of all to leave this planet, because it was blessed every day with( 每天都享有... ) 1440 sunsets!
The sixth planet was ten times larger than the last one.
It was inhabited( 居住着 ) by an old gentleman who wrote voluminous( 长篇幅的 ) books.
“Oh, look! Here is an explorer!” he exclaimed( 惊呼 ) to himself when he saw the little prince coming.
The little prince sat down on the table and panted( 喘气 ) a little.
He had already traveled so much and so far!
“Where do you come from?” the old gentleman said to him.
“What is that big book?” said the little prince. “What are you doing?”
“I am a geographer,” the old gentleman said to him.
“What is a geographer?” asked the little prince.
“A geographer is a scholar( 学者 ) who knows the location of all the seas, rivers, towns, mountains, and deserts.”
“That is very interesting,” said the little prince. “Here at last is a man who has a real profession!”
And he cast a look around him at the planet of the geographer.
It was the most magnificent( 壮观的 ) and stately( 雄伟的 ) planet that he had ever seen.
“Your planet is very beautiful,” he said. “Has it any oceans?”
“I couldn’t tell you,” said the geographer.
“Ah!” The little prince was disappointed. “Has it any mountains?”
“I couldn’t tell you,” said the geographer.
“And towns, and rivers, and deserts?”
“I couldn’t tell you that, either.”
“But you are a geographer!”
“Exactly,” the geographer said. “But I am not an explorer. I haven’t a single explorer on my planet.
It is not the geographer who goes out to count the towns, the rivers, the mountains, the seas, the oceans, and the deserts.
The geographer is much too important to go loafing about.
He does not leave his desk. But he receives the explorers in his study. He asks them questions, and he notes down what they recall( 回想 ) of their travels.
And if the recollections( 回忆 ) of any one among them seem interesting to him, the geographer orders an inquiry( 调查 ) into that explorer’s moral character.”
“Why is that?”
“Because an explorer who told lies would bring disaster on the books of the geographer. So would an explorer who drank too much.”
“Why is that?” asked the little prince.
“Because intoxicated( 喝醉的 ) men see double( 看见重影 ). Then the geographer would note down two mountains in a place where there was only one.”
“I know someone,” said the little prince, “who would make a bad explorer.”
“That is possible. Then, when the moral character of the explorer is shown to be good, an inquiry( 调查 ) is ordered into his discovery.”
“One goes to see it?”
“No. That would be too complicated( 复杂的 ). But one requires the explorer to furnish( 提供 ) proofs( 证据 ).
For example, if the discovery in question is that of a large mountain, one requires that large stones be brought back from it.”

article_info.previous: 在之前的旅行中，小王子遇到了一个想要得到别人崇拜的自大狂，还遇到了一个借酒浇愁的酒鬼，之后又遇到了一个沉迷于数星星的商人。
article_info.share_words: For it is possible for a man to be faithful and lazy at the same time.

question.cn: 小王子如何看待点街灯的人？
question.en: What did the little prince think of the lamplighter?

options.cn: 他认为点街灯的人很荒唐。
options.en: He thought that the lamplighter was absurd.

options.cn: 他认为点街灯的人很忠诚。
options.en: He thought that the lamplighter was faithful.

options.cn: 他认为点街灯的人很幸运。
options.en: He thought that the lamplighter was lucky.

analysis: 原文提到：As the little prince watched him, he felt that he loved this lamplighter who was so faithful to his orders. 所以答案为B。

question.cn: 为什么小王子对离开点街灯的人的行星感到遗憾？
question.en: Why did the little prince feel sorry to leave the lamplighter's planet?

options.cn: 因为他想和点街灯的人交朋友。
options.en: Because he wanted to make friends with the lamplighter.

options.cn: 因为这颗星球每天有1440次日落。
options.en: Because the planet was blessed every day with 1440 sunsets.

options.cn: 因为他没能帮助点街灯的人。
options.en: Because he could not help the lamplighter.

analysis: 原文提到：What the little prince did not dare confess was that he was sorry most of all to leave this planet, because it was blessed every day with 1440 sunsets! 所以答案为B。

question.cn: 第六颗行星上的老绅士是谁？
question.en: Who was the old gentleman on the sixth planet?

analysis: 原文中小王子问到老人他在做什么，提到： “I am a geographer,” the old gentleman said to him. 所以答案为A。

share_title: 100天读完4本英文书，今天是第8天
